sen.j: 中御門 経之（なかみかど つねゆき、文政3年12月17日 (旧暦)(1821年1月20日) - 明治24年(1891年)8月27日）は、幕末期の公卿にして明治期の華族。
sen.e: Tsuneyuki NAKAMIKADO (January 20, 1821-August 27, 1891) was Kugyo (the top court officials) in the end of the Edo period and the peerage in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 坊城俊明の五男として生まれるが、中御門資文の養嗣子となる。
sen.e: He was born as the fifth son of Toshiaki BOJO and became an adoptive heir of Sukefumi NAKAMIKADO.

sen.e: When an issue on the imperial sanction for the Treaty of commerce began to be discussed in 1858, he was against it as a member of the opposing group of 88 retainers (Teishin hachiju-hachi kyo [88 retainers of Imperial Court]).

sen.e: In 1863 he followed the Emperor Komei's gyoko (Emperor's going out) to the Iwashimizuhachiman-gu Shrine.

sen.e: However, after that, he became one of the Kugyo of anti-Shogunate group with Totomi IWAKURA and impeached Nariyuki NIJO, the chief adviser to the Emperor, and the Imperial prince Nakagawa no miya Asahiko who were Sabaku-ha (supporters of the Shogun) in 1866.
